The 2.3 percent jump in February construction spending was the largest increase for any month in nearly a year, since a matching 2.3 percent increase in March 1996. It far exceeded Wall Street economists' forecast for a smaller 0.9 percent spending rise.
The last month in which there was a bigger increase than in February in total construction spending was in March 1994, when it climbed by 3.4 percent, the department said.

The 1.8 percent increase in private construction spending was the largest since a 2.1 percent gain last November and included stronger spending on both new housing and on commercial buildings, like offices and hotels.
The 4.1 percent surge in public construction spending was the largest since a 4.3 percent increase in September last year, department officials said.
